src:
Interior informó que 138 personas fueron detenidas en última jornada de protestas
Según el gobierno, la cifra representa 264 menos que el día anterior.
01 Nov 2019 by Francisco Espinoza
A dos semanas del inicio de las protestas, la subsecretaría del Interior informó que 138 personas fueron detenidas entre las 09:00 horas del jueves 31 de octubre y las 09:00 horas del viernes 1 de noviembre, 264 menos que el día anterior.
Según el conteo oficial de las autoridades, 16 personas resultaron heridas ( siete policías y nueve civiles), mientras que el día anterior fueron 56, 23 y 33 respectivamente.
En cuanto a los denominados eventos graves, estos bajaron de 16 a ocho, en la región Metropolitana.
En Concepción se reportaron saqueos en dos farmacias y un minimarket, además de un intento de robo al Mall del Centro. También hubo un ataque con elementos contundentes al domicilio de alcalde de Angol.
text:
Interior reported that 138 people were arrested on the last day of protests
According to the government, the figure represents 264 less than the previous day.
01 Nov 2019 by Francisco Espinoza
Two weeks after the start of the protests, the Undersecretary of the Interior reported that 138 people were arrested between 09:00 hours on Thursday, October 31 and 09:00 hours on Friday, November 1, 264 less than the previous day.
According to the official count of the authorities, 16 people were injured (seven police officers and nine civilians), while the previous day were 56, 23 and 33 respectively.
As for the so-called serious events, these fell from 16 to eight, in the Metropolitan region.
In Concepción, looting was reported in two pharmacies and a minimarket, as well as an attempt to rob the Mall of the Center. There was also an attack with blunt elements to the address of Mayor of Angol.
